thread.title: Corrections and clarifications | News
thread.title_full: Corrections and clarifications | News | The Guardian

author: Corrections and clarifications column editor
title: Corrections and clarifications | News
text:
• An article about cryogenics said it is unregulated in the UK and “does not fall under the remit of the Human Tissue Authority, which regulates the freezing of sperm and embryos, because it was ‘not contemplated’ when the Human Tissue Act was passed in 2004”. The HTA regulates the removal, storage and use of human tissue; regulation of sperm and embryo freezing is done by the Human Fertilisation and Embryology Authority ( Promoters of cryogenics peddling false hope, says scientist who wants legal ban , 19 November, page 4).
• An editorial about science and the humanities said CP Snow’s essay The Two Cultures was published 60 years ago this month. It was actually published a month earlier, in October 1956 ( The humanities, not just science, can unlock the world’s mysteries , 21 November, page 26).
Reuse this content
